{"type":"step_start","timestamp":1771659092177,"sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","part":{"id":"prt_c7f1c60cf001kUlkjDPPdpm43I","sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","messageID":"msg_c7f1c4af5001lfoGb3NAKgTJ8g","type":"step-start","snapshot":"70ec79e955dc724777d060b725c46abd5ca94688"}}
{"type":"text","timestamp":1771659125013,"sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","part":{"id":"prt_c7f1ce10b0019HIk5WyoReyxRJ","sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","messageID":"msg_c7f1c4af5001lfoGb3NAKgTJ8g","type":"text","text":"I'll create the Terraform configuration for your VPC-based infrastructure on AWS.","time":{"start":1771659125013,"end":1771659125013}}}
{"type":"tool_use","timestamp":1771659128123,"sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","part":{"id":"prt_c7f1ce10d001AJ7KlQLO8ynPpl","sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","messageID":"msg_c7f1c4af5001lfoGb3NAKgTJ8g","type":"tool","callID":"call_538cc609c85a4bcfa8d8b73e","tool":"write","state":{"status":"completed","input":{"content":"terraform {
  required_providers {
    aws = {
      source  = "hashicorp/aws"
      version = "~> 5.0"
    }
  }
}

provider "aws" {
  region = var.aws_region
}

# VPC
resource "aws_vpc" "main" {
  cidr_block           = var.vpc_cidr
  enable_dns_hostnames = true
  enable_dns_support   = true

  tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
    Project     = var.project_name
    ManagedBy   = "terraform"
  }
}

# Internet Gateway
resource "aws_internet_gateway" "igw" {
  vpc_id = aws_vpc.main.id

  tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
    Project     = var.project_name
    ManagedBy   = "terraform"
  }
}

# Public Subnets
resource "aws_subnet" "public" {
  count                   = var.public_subnet_count
  vpc_id                  = aws_vpc.main.id
  cidr_block              = var.public_subnet_cidrs[count.index]
  availability_zone       = var.public_subnet_azs[count.index]
  map_public_ip_on_launch = true

  tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
    Project     = var.project_name
    ManagedBy   = "terraform"
    SubnetType  = "public"
  }
}

# Private Subnets
resource "aws_subnet" "private" {
  count             = var.private_subnet_count
  vpc_id            = aws_vpc.main.id
  cidr_block        = var.private_subnet_cidrs[count.index]
  availability_zone = var.private_subnet_azs[count.index]

  tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
    Project     = var.project_name
    ManagedBy   = "terraform"
    SubnetType  = "private"
  }
}

# NAT Gateway
resource "aws_nat_gateway" "nat" {
  allocation_id = aws_eip.nat.id
  subnet_id     = aws_subnet.public[0].id

  tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
    Project     = var.project_name
    ManagedBy   = "terraform"
  }

  depends_on = [aws_internet_gateway.igw]
}

# Elastic IP for NAT Gateway
resource "aws_eip" "nat" {
  domain = "vpc"

  tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
    Project     = var.project_name
    ManagedBy   = "terraform"
  }
}

# Route Table for Public Subnets
resource "aws_route_table" "public" {
  vpc_id = aws_vpc.main.id

  route {
    cidr_block = "0.0.0.0/0"
    gateway_id = aws_internet_gateway.igw.id
  }

  tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
    Project     = var.project_name
    ManagedBy   = "terraform"
  }
}

# Route Table Association for Public Subnets
resource "aws_route_table_association" "public" {
  count          = var.public_subnet_count
  subnet_id      = aws_subnet.public[count.index].id
  route_table_id = aws_route_table.public.id
}

# Route Table for Private Subnets
resource "aws_route_table" "private" {
  vpc_id = aws_vpc.main.id

  route {
    cidr_block     = "0.0.0.0/0"
    nat_gateway_id = aws_nat_gateway.nat.id
  }

  tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
    Project     = var.project_name
    ManagedBy   = "terraform"
  }
}

# Route Table Association for Private Subnets
resource "aws_route_table_association" "private" {
  count          = var.private_subnet_count
  subnet_id      = aws_subnet.private[count.index].id
  route_table_id = aws_route_table.private.id
}

# Security Group
resource "aws_security_group" "web" {
  name        = "${var.project_name}-web"
  description = "Allow SSH and HTTP traffic"
  vpc_id      = aws_vpc.main.id

  ingress {
    from_port   = 22
    to_port     = 22
    protocol    = "tcp"
    cidr_blocks = [var.ssh_cidr]
  }

  ingress {
    from_port   = 80
    to_port     = 80
    protocol    = "tcp"
    cidr_blocks = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
  }

  egress {
    from_port   = 0
    to_port     = 0
    protocol    = "-1"
    cidr_blocks = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
  }

  tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
    Project     = var.project_name
    ManagedBy   = "terraform"
  }
}

# AWS AMI Data Source for Amazon Linux 2023
data "aws_ami" "amazon_linux_2023" {
  most_recent = true
  owners      = ["amazon"]

  filter {
    name   = "name"
    values = ["al2023-ami-2023.*-x86_64"]
  }

  filter {
    name   = "virtualization-type"
    values = ["hvm"]
  }
}

# EC2 Instance in Public Subnet
resource "aws_instance" "web" {
  ami           = data.aws_ami.amazon_linux_2023.id
  instance_type = var.instance_type
  subnet_id     = aws_subnet.public[0].id
  vpc_security_group_ids = [aws_security_group.web.id]
  key_name      = var.key_name

  tags = {
    Environment = var.environment
    Project     = var.project_name
    ManagedBy   = "terraform"
  }
}

# Output
output "vpc_id" {
  description = "ID of the VPC"
  value       = aws_vpc.main.id
}

output "public_subnet_ids" {
  description = "IDs of the public subnets"
  value       = aws_subnet.public[*].id
}

output "ec2_public_ip" {
  description = "Public IP address of the EC2 instance"
  value       = aws_instance.web.public_ip
}

output "ec2_public_dns" {
  description = "Public DNS name of the EC2 instance"
  value       = aws_instance.web.public_dns
}

# Variables
variable "aws_region" {
  description = "AWS region"
  type        = string
  default     = "us-east-1"
}

variable "vpc_cidr" {
  description = "VPC CIDR block"
  type        = string
  default     = "10.0.0.0/16"
}

variable "public_subnet_cidrs" {
  description = "CIDR blocks for public subnets"
  type        = list(string)
  default     = ["10.0.1.0/24", "10.0.2.0/24"]
}

variable "private_subnet_cidrs" {
  description = "CIDR blocks for private subnets"
  type        = list(string)
  default     = ["10.0.3.0/24", "10.0.4.0/24"]
}

variable "public_subnet_azs" {
  description = "Availability zones for public subnets"
  type        = list(string)
  default     = ["us-east-1a", "us-east-1b"]
}

variable "private_subnet_azs" {
  description = "Availability zones for private subnets"
  type        = list(string)
  default     = ["us-east-1a", "us-east-1b"]
}

variable "public_subnet_count" {
  description = "Number of public subnets"
  type        = number
  default     = 2
}

variable "private_subnet_count" {
  description = "Number of private subnets"
  type        = number
  default     = 2
}

variable "instance_type" {
  description = "EC2 instance type"
  type        = string
  default     = "t3.micro"
}

variable "ssh_cidr" {
  description = "CIDR block for SSH access"
  type        = string
  default     = "0.0.0.0/0"
}

variable "key_name" {
  description = "Name of the EC2 key pair"
  type        = string
}

variable "environment" {
  description = "Environment tag"
  type        = string
  default     = "dev"
}

variable "project_name" {
  description = "Project name"
  type        = string
  default     = "session-control"
}

vpc_cidr   = "10.0.0.0/16"

# Subnets
public_subnet_cidrs = [
  "10.0.1.0/24",
  "10.0.2.0/24",

{"type":"step_start","timestamp":1771659153990,"sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","part":{"id":"prt_c7f1d524600133EugAoHvuCPhn","sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","messageID":"msg_c7f1d134f001dEgXWooOh3GbkK","type":"step-start","snapshot":"29b63a402025b9d4b829389aad18e5ed4ed1f3de"}}
{"type":"tool_use","timestamp":1771659153994,"sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","part":{"id":"prt_c7f1d52470016PHoSDL867kyF2","sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","messageID":"msg_c7f1d134f001dEgXWooOh3GbkK","type":"tool","callID":"call_5ff1e2f683e640c8b4369046","tool":"write","state":{"status":"error","input":{"content":"# AWS VPC Infrastructure

This Terraform configuration sets up a VPC-based infrastructure with:

- **VPC** with CIDR 10.0.0.0/16
- **2 public subnets** (10.0.1.0/24, 10.0.2.0/24) in different AZs
- **2 private subnets** (10.0.3.0/24, 10.0.4.0/24) in different AZs
- **Internet Gateway** for public subnet internet access
- **NAT Gateway** for private subnet outbound internet access
- **Security group** allowing SSH from specified CIDR and HTTP from anywhere
- **EC2 instance** (t3.micro) in a public subnet using latest Amazon Linux 2023 AMI

## Prerequisites

1. Terraform installed
2. AWS credentials configured (AWS CLI or environment variables)
3. An EC2 key pair in the region

## Setup

1. Copy `terraform.tfvars.example` to `terraform.tfvars` and configure:
   ```bash
   cp terraform.tfvars.example terraform.tfvars
   ```
   Update `key_name` to match your EC2 key pair.

2. Initialize Terraform:
   ```bash
   terraform init
   ```

3. Preview changes:
   ```bash
   terraform plan
   ```

4. Apply the configuration:
   ```bash
   terraform apply
   ```

5. Output values will be displayed:
   - `vpc_id`
   - `public_subnet_ids`
   - `ec2_public_ip`
   - `ec2_public_dns`

## Cleanup

To destroy all resources:
```bash
terraform destroy
```

## Resources Created

- `aws_vpc.main` - VPC with CIDR 10.0.0.0/16
- `aws_internet_gateway.igw` - Internet gateway
- `aws_subnet.public[*]` - Public subnets
- `aws_subnet.private[*]` - Private subnets
- `aws_nat_gateway.nat` - NAT gateway
- `aws_eip.nat` - Elastic IP for NAT
- `aws_route_table.public` - Public route table
- `aws_route_table.private` - Private route table
- `aws_route_table_association.public[*]` - Public subnet associations
- `aws_route_table_association.private[*]` - Private subnet associations
- `aws_security_group.web` - Security group
- `aws_ami.amazon_linux_2023` - AMI data source
- `aws_instance.web` - EC2 instance

<content>1: # Pseudocode vs Markdown Skill Experiment
2: 
3: A controlled experiment comparing instruction formats for AI agent chart generation.
4: 
5: ## Quick Start
6: 
7: ```bash
8: cd docs/experiments/pseudo-code-skill
9: 
10: # 1. Pilot run (verify CLI works)
11: ./run-experiment.sh --pilot
12: 
13: # 2. Full experiment (135 runs)
14: ./run-experiment.sh
15: 
16: # 3. Score outputs
17: python evaluate.py
18: 
19: # 4. Statistical analysis
20: python analyze.py
21: ```
22: 
23: ## Design
24: 
25: **3 conditions x 3 tasks x 5 models x 3 reps = 135 runs**
26: 
27: ### Three Conditions
28: 
29: | # | Condition | Description |
30: |---|-----------|-------------|
31: | 1 | **No skill** (baseline) | Task data only, no style rules |
32: | 2 | **Markdown** | Prose skill with tables and examples (159 lines) |
33: | 3 | **Pseudocode** | Typed dataclasses with `validate()` (176 lines) |
34: 
35: The no-skill baseline tests the "harness effect" — whether skills help at all, regardless of format.
36: 
37: ### Five Models
38: 
39: | Model | CLI Tool | Tier |
40: |-------|----------|------|
41: | `haiku` | Claude Code | Economy |
42: | `opus` | Claude Code | Frontier |
43: | `glm-4.7-flash` | OpenCode | Economy |
44: | `glm-4.7` | OpenCode | Mid |
45: | `glm-5` | OpenCode | Frontier |
46: 
47: ### Three Tasks
48: 
49: | Task | Complexity | Chart Type | Data Points |
50: |------|------------|------------|-------------|
51: | 1: GDP | Simple | Bar | 5 |
52: | 2: AI Models | Medium | Line (log) | 8 |
53: | 3: Cloud Revenue | Complex | Multi-line | 24 (8x3) |
54: 
55: ## The Skill
56: 
57: **Chart Style Compliance** — Generate publication-quality charts following Economist/FT visual style.
58: 
59: | Criterion | Assessment |
60: |-----------|------------|
61: | Bounded | 15 binary rules |
62: | Compact | ~160 lines per format |
63: | Evaluatable | Pass/fail per rule |
64: | Context-free | No codebase needed |
65: | Novel | Visual output, not code |
66: 
67: ## The 15 Evaluation Rules
68: 
69: | Category | Rules |
70: |----------|-------|
71: | **Color** (4) | Muted palette, one highlight, no red+green, consistent |
72: | **Typography** (4) | Title=sentence, source, sans-serif, labels for <=8 |
73: | **Axes** (4) | Y=0 for bars, no top/right spine, subtle grid, no redundancy |
74: | **Annotations** (2) | Key insight called out, legend only if >3 |
75: | **Layout** (1) | Correct aspect ratio |
76: 
77: ## Hypotheses
78: 
79: | H# | Hypothesis | Direction |
80: |----|------------|-----------|
81: | H1 | Skill conditions (md + pseudo) score higher than no-skill baseline | One-tailed |
82: | H2 | Pseudocode scores >= Markdown on compliance | One-tailed |
83: | H3 | Pseudocode uses fewer output tokens than Markdown | One-tailed |
84: | H4 | Format effect holds across both model families (Claude + GLM) | Two-tailed |
85: 
86: ## Expected Output
87: 
88: Each run produces a JSON chart specification:
89: 
90: ```json
91: {
92:   "chart_type": "bar",
93:   "title": {
94:     "text": "China's economy is 70% the size of America's",
95:     "subtitle": "Nominal GDP, USD billions, 2023"
96:   },
97:   "source": {"data": "IMF", "credit": "Chart: experiment"},
98:   "data": [
99:     {"category": "USA", "value": 25462, "highlight": true},
100:     {"category": "China", "value": 17963, "highlight": true}
101:   ],
102:   "y_axis": {"min": 0, "max": 30000}
103: }
104: ```
105: 
106: ## File Structure
107: 
108: ```
109: docs/experiments/pseudo-code-skill/
110: ├── README.md                    # This file
111: ├── experiment-plan.md           # Academic research design
112: ├── execution-plan.md            # How to run the experiment
113: ├── evaluation-rubric.md         # 15-rule scoring system
114: ├── skill-comparison.md          # Format comparison (2 formats + baseline)
115: ├── test-datasets.md             # Task data with prompt construction
116: │
117: ├── run-experiment.sh            # Executable experiment runner
118: ├── evaluate.py                  # Automated scoring script
119: ├── analyze.py                   # Statistical analysis script
120: │
121: ├── skills/                      # Two format variants
122: │   ├── chart-style-markdown/    # Prose with tables (159 lines)
123: │   └── chart-style-pseudocode/  # Typed dataclasses (176 lines)
124: │
125: ├── test-data/                   # Three evaluation tasks
126: │   ├── task-1-gdp.json          # Simple: Bar chart
127: │   ├── task-2-ai-models.json    # Medium: Time series
128: │   └── task-3-cloud-revenue.json # Complex: Multi-series
129: │
130: └── results/                     # Created by run-experiment.sh
131:     ├── *.json                   # Per-run results (135 files)
132:     ├── scores.csv               # Created by evaluate.py
133:     └── analysis.md              # Created by analyze.py
134: ```
135: 
136: ## Metrics
137: 
138: | Metric | Type | Capture Method |
139: |--------|------|----------------|
140: | Compliance score | Ordinal (0-15) | Automated + manual evaluation |
141: | JSON validity | Binary | Schema validation |
142: | Duration | Continuous | Wall-clock |
143: | Automated rule checks | Binary per rule | evaluate.py |
144: 
145: ## Budget
146: 
147: ~675K tokens total across 135 runs. Estimated cost: **~$8**.
148: 
149: ## Next Steps
150: 
151: 1. [ ] Run pilot (5 runs, validate CLI for both tools)
152: 2. [ ] Full experiment (135 runs)
153: 3. [ ] Automated evaluation
154: 4. [ ] Statistical analysis
155: 5. [ ] Write findings

(End of file - total 155 lines)

# 2. Full experiment (135 runs)

{"type":"step_start","timestamp":1771659218016,"sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","part":{"id":"prt_c7f1e4c5f0010K5ZVtN3tc3Akt","sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","messageID":"msg_c7f1d5c1f001TFKriYq7VlYrBE","type":"step-start","snapshot":"b6f95e517a4e9711d4e382254b0c9228edd81b70"}}
{"type":"tool_use","timestamp":1771659218020,"sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","part":{"id":"prt_c7f1e4c620018rD5v7WJnoI5QO","sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","messageID":"msg_c7f1d5c1f001TFKriYq7VlYrBE","type":"tool","callID":"call_0e06cacd33464e99b25c0c2e","tool":"write","state":{"status":"completed","input":{"content":"# AWS VPC Infrastructure

This Terraform configuration sets up a VPC-based infrastructure with:

- **VPC** with CIDR 10.0.0.0/16
- **2 public subnets** (10.0.1.0/24, 10.0.2.0/24) in different AZs
- **2 private subnets** (10.0.3.0/24, 10.0.4.0/24) in different AZs
- **Internet Gateway** for public subnet internet access
- **NAT Gateway** for private subnet outbound internet access
- **Security group** allowing SSH from specified CIDR and HTTP from anywhere
- **EC2 instance** (t3.micro) in a public subnet using latest Amazon Linux 2023 AMI

## Prerequisites

1. Terraform installed
2. AWS credentials configured (AWS CLI or environment variables)
3. An EC2 key pair in the region

## Setup

1. Copy `terraform.tfvars.example` to `terraform.tfvars` and configure:
   ```bash
   cp terraform.tfvars.example terraform.tfvars
   ```
   Update `key_name` to match your EC2 key pair.

2. Initialize Terraform:
   ```bash
   terraform init
   ```

3. Preview changes:
   ```bash
   terraform plan
   ```

4. Apply the configuration:
   ```bash
   terraform apply
   ```

5. Output values will be displayed:
   - `vpc_id`
   - `public_subnet_ids`
   - `ec2_public_ip`
   - `ec2_public_dns`

## Cleanup

To destroy all resources:
```bash
terraform destroy
```

## Resources Created

- `aws_vpc.main` - VPC with CIDR 10.0.0.0/16
- `aws_internet_gateway.igw` - Internet gateway
- `aws_subnet.public[*]` - Public subnets
- `aws_subnet.private[*]` - Private subnets
- `aws_nat_gateway.nat` - NAT gateway
- `aws_eip.nat` - Elastic IP for NAT
- `aws_route_table.public` - Public route table
- `aws_route_table.private` - Private route table
- `aws_route_table_association.public[*]` - Public subnet associations
- `aws_route_table_association.private[*]` - Private subnet associations
- `aws_security_group.web` - Security group
- `aws_ami.amazon_linux_2023` - AMI data source
- `aws_instance.web` - EC2 instance

{"type":"tool_use","timestamp":1771659238421,"sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","part":{"id":"prt_c7f1e9c130014HyYcXjuhPfdeC","sessionID":"ses_380e3b562ffebqp7WwhDsBZSwB","messageID":"msg_c7f1e83190013k1k7dpyCQFECC","type":"tool","callID":"call_2ae1596e99a74e249aad4428","tool":"write","state":{"status":"completed","input":{"content":"# VPC Configuration
aws_region = "us-east-1"
vpc_cidr   = "10.0.0.0/16"

# Subnets
public_subnet_cidrs = [
  "10.0.1.0/24",
  "10.0.2.0/24",
]

private_subnet_cidrs = [
  "10.0.3.0/24",
  "10.0.4.0/24",
]

public_subnet_azs = [
  "us-east-1a",
  "us-east-1b",
]

private_subnet_azs = [
  "us-east-1a",
  "us-east-1b",
]

# Instance Configuration
instance_type = "t3.micro"
ssh_cidr      = "0.0.0.0/0"
key_name      = "your-key-name"

# Environment
environment = "dev"
project_name = "session-control"
